\par{}{\centering \textbf{\large Primary Contacts for
Hall A Equipment}{\large \par{}\par{}\par{}}
}
 \setlength{\baselineskip}{1.5pc}

\section*{Introduction }

This document list the responsible personnel for each of the major Hall A subsystems.
This information is a convienient condensation of information provided
in the ``Hall A Experimental Equipment Operations Manual''.


\section*{Beamline Equipment}

The burden for much of the upkeep of beamline equipment falls on Accelerator
Division. If problems occur with accelerator division maintained beamline components
then reporting the problem to the MCC crew chief should result in the appropriate
personnel being contacted. If the problem is particularly severe then the Run
Coordinator and the Hall Leader should be contacted. They may then choose to
notify the Program Deputy directly.

There are however many components of the Hall A beamline for which there are
either staff or user contacts. These items and the associated personnel are
listed in the table below. In addition, some of the accelerator personnel are
listed for completness.

\vspace{0.3cm}  {\centering

\vspace{0.3cm}


\section*{Scattering Chamber and Targets}

The scattering chamber is typically a low maintenance item but it is a vacuum
system and hence problems may occur. The day to day operations of the cryogenic
targets are managed by the Hall A Staff while major maintenance operations are
handled by the Cryogenic Target Group (Physics Divisiion). Occasionally the
cryogenic targets experience difficulties due to failures of the End Station
Refrigerator which supplies the coolant. In these cases the Cryogenics Group
of the Accelerator Division should be contacted. Some key contact numbers are
given in the following table.

\vspace{0.3cm} { \centering 
\begin{table}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}

\par{} \vspace{0.3cm}


\section*{Spectrometers}

The HRS spectrometer pair are by far the most complex systems in the hall. Although
they have proven extremely reliable, some difficulties are inevitable. Cryogenics
difficulties are handled by the Cryogenics Group of Accelerator Division. Vacuum
and Mechanical problems are serviced by the Hall A technical staff and Controls
have a Physics Staff member who is the contact. Some useful contact numbers
are given in the table.

\vspace{0.3cm}{ \centering 
\begin{table}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline 
Component&
 A Staff&
 \#&
 Outside Group&
 \#&
 Remark\\
\hline

&
&
 Or Technician \\
&
&
&
&
&
 On Call\\
\hline 
Cryogenics&
&

 7405&
\\
&
&
&
 Cryo on Call&
 MCC&
\\
\hline

 Ed Folts&

&
&
 Mechanical\\
\hline 
Controls&
 J. Gomez&
 7498&
&
&
 \\
\hline 
\end{tabular}
\label{tab:Spect}


\caption{Personnel for the Hall A HRS spectrometers.}
\end{table}
}

\par{} \vspace{0.3cm}


\section*{Detectors}

The detectors systems typically have both staff and user support personel. The
chambers gas system is supported by the Hall A technical staff.
